致.definition: (literary) to send; to transmit; to convey; (bound form) to cause; to lead to; consequently

致仕.definition: to retire from a government post (old)

致以.definition: to express; to present; to extend; to tender (greetings, thanks etc)

致力.definition: to work for; to devote one's efforts to

致命.definition: fatal; mortal; deadly; to sacrifice one's life

致命傷.definition: mortal wound; (fig.) fatal weakness; Achilles' heel

致意.definition: to send one's greetings; to send one's best regards; to devote attention to

致敬.definition: to salute; to pay one's respects to; to pay tribute to; to pay homage to

致死.definition: to cause death; to be lethal; to be deadly

致殘.definition: to be crippled (in an accident etc)

致畸.definition: producing abnormality; leading to malformation; teratogenic

致病.definition: to cause disease; to be pathogenic

致詞.definition: to make a speech; to make some remarks

致謝.definition: expression of gratitude; to give thanks; a thank-you note; acknowledgement

致辭.definition: to express in words or writing; to make a speech (esp. short introduction, vote of thanks, afterword, funeral homily etc); to address (an audience); same as 致詞|致词
